0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eDevelopers, myself included, usually prefer to make all code changes manually, so that nothing happens to our code without reviewing it first. That is until we trust a tool to make those changes safely for us. An example is \u003cstrong\u003eWebStorm\u003c/strong\u003e, which we trust when renaming a \u003ccode\u003eclass\u003c/code\u003e or a \u003ccode\u003emethod\u003c/code\u003e. Since 🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e may still feel like a new tool, not all of us will be able to trust it immediately.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eA good way to gain trust is two run without \u003ccode\u003e--fix\u003c/code\u003e option, and observe error messages. Another way is to use traditional version control tactics. Before running 🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e you should do a \u003ccode\u003egit commit\u003c/code\u003e. Then after running 🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e, you’ll be able to inspect the changes it made using \u003ccode\u003egit diff\u003c/code\u003e and \u003ccode\u003egit status\u003c/code\u003e. You still have the chance to run \u003ccode\u003egit checkout -- .\u003c/code\u003e at any time to revert all the changes that 🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e has made. If you need more fine-grained control, you can also use \u003ccode\u003egit add -p\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003egit add -i\u003c/code\u003e to interactively stage only the changes you want to has roots above and branches below.\nThe leaves protecting it are the Vedas.\nOne who knows this, truly knows.\u003c/strong\u003e\n\u003cstrong\u003eThe tender sprouts of this mighty tree\nare the senses nourished by the gunas.\nThe branches extend both above and below.\nThe secondary roots going downward represent actions\nthat bind the individual soul to earthly existence.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e(c) “Bhagavatgita”, chapter 15\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ca target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\" href=\"https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/blob/master/images/ashvattha.jpeg\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/raw/master/images/ashvattha.jpeg\" alt=\"Ashvattha\" style=\"max-width: 100%;\"\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eOn the bottom level of 🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e layes down \u003cstrong\u003eSyntax Tree\u003c/strong\u003e. This is data structure that makes it possible to do \u003ca href=\"https://dev.to/viveknayyar/revealing-the-magic-of-ast-by-writing-babel-plugins-1h01\" rel=\"nofollow\"\u003ecrazy transformations in a simplest possible way\u003c/a\u003e. It is used mostly in compilers development.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eYou can read about it in \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/jamiebuilds/babel-handbook/blob/master/translations/en/plugin-handbook.md\"\u003eBabel Plugin Handbook\u003c/a\u003e. To understand how things work from the inside take a look at \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/jamiebuilds/the-super-tiny-compiler\"\u003eSuper Tiny Compiler\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003ePreoccupied with a single leaf, you won't see the tree.\nPreoccupied with a single tree, you'll miss the entire forest.\nWhen you look at a tree, see it for its leaves, its branches, its trunk and the roots, then and only then will you see the tree.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e(c) Takuan Soho, \"The Unfettered Mind: Writings of the Zen Master to the Sword Master\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eConsider next piece of code:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"hello = 'world';\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ehello\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-c1\"\u003e=\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e'world'\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-kos\"\u003e;\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIt looks this way in \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/estree/estree\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eESTree\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e \u003cstrong\u003eJavaScript\u003c/strong\u003e syntax format:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"{\n    \u0026quot;type\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;AssignmentExpression\u0026quot;,\n    \u0026quot;operator\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;=\u0026quot;,\n    \u0026quot;left\u0026quot;: {\n        \u0026quot;type\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;Identifier\u0026quot;,\n        \u0026quot;name\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;hello\u0026quot;\n    },\n    \u0026quot;right\u0026quot;: {\n        \u0026quot;type\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;StringLiteral\u0026quot;,\n        \u0026quot;value\u0026quot;: \u0026quot;world\u0026quot;\n    }\n}\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e{\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"type\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eAssignmentExpression\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"operator\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e=\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"left\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"type\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eIdentifier\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"name\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003ehello\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n    },\n    \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"right\"\u003c/span\u003e: {\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"type\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eStringLiteral\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e,\n        \u003cspan class=\"pl-ent\"\u003e\"value\"\u003c/span\u003e: \u003cspan class=\"pl-s\"\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003eworld\u003cspan class=\"pl-pds\"\u003e\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n    }\n}\u003c/pre\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cblockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eWhen one is not capable of true intelligence, it is good to consult with someone of good sense. An advisor will fulfill the Way when he makes a decision by selfless and frank intelligence because he is not personally involved. This way of doing things will certainly be seen by others as being strongly rooted. It is, for example, like a large tree with many roots.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e(c) Yamamoto Tsunetomo \"Hagakure\"\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/blockquote\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e🐊\u003cstrong\u003ePutout\u003c/strong\u003e based on \u003ca href=\"https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/main/packages/babel-parser/ast/spec.md#readme\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eBabel AST\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/a\u003e. study. In the lowest level, a person studies but nothing comes of it, and he feels that both he and others are unskillful. At this point he is worthless. In the middle level he is still useless but is aware of his own insufficiencies and can also see the insufficiencies of others. At a higher level, he has pride concerning his own ability, rejoices in praise from others, and laments the lack of ability in his fellows. This man has worth. At the highest level a man has the look of knowing nothing.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e(c) Yamamoto Tsunetomo href="https://github.com/facebook/jscodeshift"><strong>JSCodeshift</strong></a> has no <strong>config</strong> and <strong>plugins</strong> support.</li></ul><p dir="auto">🐊<strong>Putout</strong> on the other hand can make more drastic code transformations that directly affects your codebase making it a better place to code 💻:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅ <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/plugin-declare-before-reference#readme">fixes Reference Errors</a>;</li><li>✅ <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/plugin-declare#readme">declares variables</a>;</li><li>✅ <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/plugin-convert-commonjs-to-esm#readme">convert CommonJS to ESM</a>;</li><li>✅ <a href="#-built-in-transformations">...and much more 😏!</a></li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🚚 Installation</h2><a id="user-content--installation" class="anchor-element"      use additional rules from directory   --transform [replacer]      apply Replacer, for example 'var __a = __b -> const __a = __b', read about Replacer https://git.io/JqcMn   --plugins [plugins]     disable all found rules (set baseline) and save them to '.putout.json' walking up parent directories   --match [pattern]           read '.putout.json' and convert 'rules' to 'match' according to data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npx putout lib test"><pre class="notranslate"><code>npx putout lib test</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">To apply the transforms, use <code>--fix</code>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npx putout lib test --fix"><pre class="notranslate"><code>npx putout lib test --fix</code></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">☝️Commit your code before running 🐊Putout</h3><a id="user-content-️commit-your-code-before-running-putout" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ☝️Commit your code before running 🐊Putout" href="#️commit-your-code-before-running-putout"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Developers, myself included, usually prefer to make all code changes manually, so that nothing happens to our code without reviewing it first. That is until we trust a tool to make those changes safely for us. An example is <strong>WebStorm</strong>, which we trust when renaming a <code>class</code> or a <code>method</code>. Since 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> may still feel like a new tool, not all of us will be able to trust it immediately.</p><p dir="auto">A good way to gain trust is two run without <code>--fix</code> option, and observe error messages. Another way is to use traditional version control tactics. Before running 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> you should do a <code>git commit</code>. Then after running 🐊<strong>Putout</strong>, you’ll be able to inspect the changes it made using <code>git diff</code> and <code>git status</code>. You still have the chance to run <code>git checkout -- .</code> at any time to revert all the changes that 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> has made. If you need more fine-grained control, you can also use <code>git add -p</code> or <code>git add -i</code> to interactively stage only the changes you want to keep.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Environment variables</h3><a id="user-content-environment-variables" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Environment variables" href="#environment-variables"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 variables:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>PUTOUT_CONFIG_FILE</code> - path to <a href="#-configuration">configuration</a> file;</li><li><code>PUTOUT_FILES</code> - files that should be processed split by comma (<code>,</code>);</li></ul><p dir="auto">Example:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="PUTOUT_FILES=lib,test dir="auto"><strong>Ruler</strong> can:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅ <code>putout --enable [rule]</code>;</li><li>✅ <code>putout --disable [rule]</code>;</li><li>✅ <code>putout --enable-all</code>;</li><li>✅ <code>putout --disable-all</code>;</li></ul><p dir="auto"><em>☝️Remember, <strong>Ruler</strong> should never be used with <code>--fix</code>, because unclear things makes 🐊 <strong>Putout</strong> angry and you can find him barking at you:</em></p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 <code>type</code> field or <code>type=commonjs</code> your package will beconverted to <code>CommonJS</code> automatically. has roots above and branches below.The leaves protecting it are the Vedas.One who knows this, truly knows.</strong><strong>The tender sprouts of this mighty treeare the senses nourished by the gunas.The branches extend both above and below.The secondary roots going downward represent actionsthat bind the individual soul to earthly existence.</strong></p><p dir="auto"><strong>(c) “Bhagavatgita”, chapter 15</strong></p></blockquote><p dir="auto"><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/blob/master/images/ashvattha.jpeg"><img src="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/raw/master/images/ashvattha.jpeg" alt="Ashvattha" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></p><p dir="auto">On the bottom level of 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> layes down <strong>Syntax Tree</strong>. This is data structure that makes it possible to do <a href="https://dev.to/viveknayyar/revealing-the-magic-of-ast-by-writing-babel-plugins-1h01" rel="nofollow">crazy transformations in a simplest possible way</a>. It is used mostly in compilers development.</p><p dir="auto">You can read about it in <a href="https://github.com/jamiebuilds/babel-handbook/blob/master/translations/en/plugin-handbook.md">Babel Plugin Handbook</a>. To understand how things work from the inside take a look at <a href="https://github.com/jamiebuilds/the-super-tiny-compiler">Super Tiny Compiler</a>.</p><blockquote><p dir="auto"><strong>Preoccupied with a single leaf, you won't see the tree.Preoccupied with a single tree, you'll miss the entire forest.When you look at a tree, see it for its leaves, its branches, its trunk and the roots, then and only then will you see the tree.</strong></p><p dir="auto"><strong>(c) Takuan Soho, "The Unfettered Mind: Writings of the Zen Master to the Sword Master"</strong></p></blockquote><p dir="auto">Consider next piece of code:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="hello = 'world';"><pre><span class="pl-s1">hello</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-s">'world'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">It looks this way in <a href="https://github.com/estree/estree"><strong>ESTree</strong></a> <strong>JavaScript</strong> syntax format:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{    "type": "AssignmentExpression",    "operator": "=",    "left": {        "type": "Identifier",        "name": "hello"    }, {        <span class="pl-ent">"type"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>Identifier<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-ent">"name"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>hello<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    },    <span class="pl-ent">"right"</span>: {        <span class="pl-ent">"type"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>StringLiteral<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>,        <span class="pl-ent">"value"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>world<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    }}</pre></div><blockquote><p dir="auto"><strong>When one is not capable of true intelligence, it is good to consult with someone of good sense. This way of doing things will certainly be seen by others as being strongly rooted. It is, for example, like a large tree with many roots.</strong></p><p dir="auto"><strong>(c) Yamamoto Tsunetomo "Hagakure"</strong></p></blockquote><p dir="auto">🐊<strong>Putout</strong> based on <a href="https://github.com/babel/babel/blob/main/packages/babel-parser/ast/spec.md#readme"><strong>Babel AST</strong></a>. In the lowest level, a person studies but nothing comes of it, and he feels that both he and others are unskillful. At this point he is worthless. In the middle level he is still useless but is aware of his own insufficiencies and can also see the insufficiencies of others. At a higher level, he has pride concerning his own ability, rejoices in praise from others, and laments the lack of ability in his fellows. This man has worth. At the highest level a man has the look of knowing nothing.</strong></p><p dir="auto"><strong>(c) Yamamoto Tsunetomo "Hagakure"</strong></p></blockquote><p dir="auto">In the similar way works options:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>name</code> - name of processed file</li><li><code>source</code> - source code of processed file</li><li><code>index</code> - current index</li><li><code>count</code> - processing files count</li><li><code>filesCount</code> - count of files with errors</li><li><code>errorsCount</code> count of errors</li></ul><p dir="auto">You can avoid any of this and use only what you need. of your choose, it can be:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅<a href="https://github.com/putoutjs/printer"><code>putout</code></a> (<em>default</em>)</li><li>✅<a href="https://babeljs.io/docs/babel-generator" set any other update <code>.putout.json</code> with:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{    "printer": "recast"}"><pre>{    <span class="pl-ent">"printer"</span>: <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>recast<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>}</pre></div><p dir="auto"><code>@putout/printer</code>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅ much simpler in support then <code>recast</code>;</li><li>✅ opinionated and has good defaults;</li><li>✅ produces code like it was processed by <strong>ESLint</strong>;</li><li>✅ twice faster then <code>recast</code>;</li></ul><p dir="auto"><code>recast</code>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅ tryies to preserve formatting, and in 70% succeeded;</li><li>❌ for other cases you need <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/eslint-plugin-putout#readme"><code>eslint-plugin-putout</code></a>;</li><li>❌ slowest printer: involves additional parser + sophisticated printer;</li></ul><p dir="auto"><code>babel</code>:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>✅ faster then <code>recast</code>;</li><li>❌ <a href="https://github.com/babel/babel/issues/5139" data-hovercard-type="issue" data-hovercard-url="/babel/babel/issues/5139/hovercard">produces throw away code</a>;</li></ul><p dir="auto">You can a <code>peerDependency</code> to your <code>packages.json</code> (>= of version you developing for).</p><p dir="auto">☝️ <em>Always add keywords <code>putout</code>, <code>putout-plugin</code> when position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const removeDebugger = require('..');const test = require('@putout/test')(__dirname, {    'remove-debugger': removeDebugger,});// this is how we test that messages is correcttest('remove debugger: report', (t) => {    t.reportCode('debugger', 'Unexpected "debugger" statement');    t.end();});// statement should be removed so result is emptytest('remove debugger: transformCode', (t) => {    t.transformCode('debugger', '');    t.end();});"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">removeDebugger</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'..'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-s1">test</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'@putout/test'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">__dirname</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-s">'remove-debugger'</span>: <span class="pl-s1">removeDebugger</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-c">// this is how we test that messages is correct</span><span class="pl-s1">test</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'remove debugger: report'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">reportCode</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'debugger'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'Unexpected "debugger" statement'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>    <span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">end</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-c">// statement should be removed so result is empty</span><span class="pl-s1">test</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'remove debugger: transformCode'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-c1">=></span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">transformCode</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'debugger'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">''</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>    <span class="pl-s1">t</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">end</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">As you see test runner it is little bit extended 📼<a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/supertape#readme"><strong>Supertape</strong></a>.To see a more sophisticated example look at <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/plugin-remove-console#readme">@putout/plugin-remove-console</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🤷‍♂️ What if I don't want to publish a plugin?</h3><a id="user-content-️-what-if-i-dont-want-to-publish-a-plugin" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: 🤷‍♂️ What if I don't want to publish a plugin?" href="#️-what-if-i-dont-want-to-publish-a-plugin"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">If you don't want to publish a <strong>plugin</strong> you developed, you can pass it to 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> as an <code>object</code> described earlier. Here is <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/mock-import/blob/v1.0.8/lib/convert-imports/index.js#L19-L33">how it can look like</a>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="putout('const a = 5', {    plugins: [        ['remove-unused-variables', require('@putout/plugin-remove-unused-variables')],    ],});"><pre><span class="pl-en">putout</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'const a = 5'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">plugins</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span>        <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'remove-unused-variables'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'@putout/plugin-remove-unused-variables'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Where <code>plugins</code> is an <code>array</code> that contains <code>[name, implementation]</code> <code>tuples</code>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">🛴 Codemods</h2><a id="user-content--codemods" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: 🛴 Codemods" href="#-codemods"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">🐊<strong>Putout</strong> supports <code>codemodes</code> in the similar to plugins way, just create a directory <code>~/.putout</code> and put your plugins there. Here is example: <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/v12.0.0/codemods/convert-tape-to-supertape#install">convert-tape-to-supertape</a> and <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/commit/ad02cebc344ce73cdee668cffc5078bf08830d52">this is example of work</a>.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto"><code>rulesdir</code></h3><a id="user-content-rulesdir" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: rulesdir" href="#rulesdir"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">When you have plugins related to your project and you don't want to publish them (because it cannot be reused right now). Use <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/rules"><code>rulesdir</code></a>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="putout --rulesdir ./rules"><pre>putout --rulesdir ./rules</pre></div><p dir="auto">This way you can keep rules specific for your project and run them on each lint.</p><p dir="auto">☝️ <em>Remember: if you want to exclude file from loading, add prefix <code>not-rule-</code> and 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> will ignore it (in the same way as he does for <code>node_modules</code>).</em></p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">⏣ Integration with ESLint</h2><a id="user-content--integration-with-eslint" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ⏣ Integration with ESLint" href="#-integration-with-eslint"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><blockquote><p dir="auto">Find and fix problems in your <strong>JavaScript</strong> code</p><p dir="auto">(c) <a href="https://eslint.org/" rel="nofollow">eslint.org</a></p></blockquote><p dir="auto">If you see that 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> breaks formatting of your code, use <strong>ESLint</strong> plugin <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/eslint-plugin-putout#eslint-plugin-putout--">eslint-plugin-putout</a>.</p><p dir="auto">Install <code>eslint-plugin-putout</code> with:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="npm i eslint eslint-plugin-putout -D"><pre class="notranslate"><code>npm i eslint eslint-plugin-putout -D</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Then create <code>.eslintrc.json</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-json notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="{    "extends": [        "plugin:putout/recommended"    ],    "plugins": ["putout"]}"><pre>{    <span class="pl-ent">"extends"</span>: [        <span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>plugin:putout/recommended<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>    ],    <span class="pl-ent">"plugins"</span>: [<span class="pl-s"><span class="pl-pds">"</span>putout<span class="pl-pds">"</span></span>]}</pre></div><p dir="auto">And use with 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> this way:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="putout --fix lib"><pre>putout --fix lib</pre></div><p dir="auto">To set custom config file for <strong>ESLint</strong> use <code>ESLINT_CONFIG_FILE</code> env variable:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="ESLINT_CONFIG_FILE=test.eslintrc.json putout --fix lib"><pre>ESLINT_CONFIG_FILE=test.eslintrc.json putout --fix lib</pre></div><p dir="auto">To disable <strong>ESLint</strong> support use <code>NO_ESLINT</code> env variable:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="NO_ESLINT=1 putout --fix lib"><pre>NO_ESLINT=1 putout --fix lib</pre></div><p dir="auto">If you want to ignore <strong>ESLint</strong> warnings (if you for some reason have annoying unfixable errors 🤷) use <code>NO_ESLINT_WARNINGS=1</code>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="NO_ESLINT_WARNINGS=1 putout --fix lib"><pre>NO_ESLINT_WARNINGS=1 putout --fix lib</pre></div><p dir="auto">You can even lint without <strong>CLI</strong> using <strong>ESlint</strong> only, since 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> is bundled to <code>eslint-plugin-putout</code>:</p><div class="snippet-clipboard-content notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="eslint --fix lib"><pre class="notranslate"><code>eslint --fix lib</code></pre></div><p dir="auto">Applies 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> transformations for you :).</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">ESLint API</h3><a id="user-content-eslint-api" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ESLint API" href="#eslint-api"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><strong>ESLint</strong> begins his work as a formatter when 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> done his transformations. That's why it is used a lot in different parts of application, for testing purpose and using <strong>API</strong> in a simplest possible way. You can access it using <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/eslint#readme"><code>@putout/eslint</code></a>:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="import eslint from '@putout/eslint';"><pre><span class="pl-k">import</span> <span class="pl-s1">eslint</span> <span class="pl-k">from</span> <span class="pl-s">'@putout/eslint'</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">To use it simply write:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const [source, places] = await eslint({    name: 'hello.js',    code: `const t = 'hi'\n`,    fix: false,});"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">source</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">places</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">await</span> <span class="pl-en">eslint</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">name</span>: <span class="pl-s">'hello.js'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">code</span>: <span class="pl-s">`const t = 'hi'\n`</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">fix</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">Doesn't it look similar to 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> way? It definitely is! But... It has a couple of differences you should remember:</p><ul dir="auto"><li>☝️ <em><a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout#plugins">🐊<strong>Putout</strong> returns object with <code>code</code> and <code>places</code> properties</a>.</em></li><li>☝️ <em><strong>ESLint</strong> has a <code>name</code> property that is used to calculate configuration file.</em></li></ul><p dir="auto">And you can even override any of <strong>ESLint</strong> ⚙️ options with help of <code>config</code> property:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const [source, places] = await eslint({    name: 'hello.js',    code: `const t = 'hi'\n`,    fix: false,    config: {        extends: [            'plugin:putout/recommended',        ],    },});"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">source</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">places</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">await</span> <span class="pl-en">eslint</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">name</span>: <span class="pl-s">'hello.js'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">code</span>: <span class="pl-s">`const t = 'hi'\n`</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">fix</span>: <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">config</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>        <span class="pl-c1">extends</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span>            <span class="pl-s">'plugin:putout/recommended'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>        <span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you want to apply 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> transformations using <a href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/tree/master/packages/eslint-plugin-putout#readme"><code>putout/putout</code></a> <strong>ESLint</strong> rule, enable 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> with the same called flag lowercased:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="const [source, places] = await eslint({    name: 'hello.js',    code: `const t = 'hi'\n`,    fix: true,    putout: true,    config: {        extends: [            'plugin:putout/recommended',        ],    },});"><pre><span class="pl-k">const</span> <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s1">source</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">places</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">await</span> <span class="pl-en">eslint</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-c1">name</span>: <span class="pl-s">'hello.js'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">code</span>: <span class="pl-s">`const t = 'hi'\n`</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">fix</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">putout</span>: <span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-c1">config</span>: <span class="pl-kos">{</span>        <span class="pl-c1">extends</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span>            <span class="pl-s">'plugin:putout/recommended'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>        <span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>    <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">It is disabled by default, because <strong>ESLint</strong> always runs after 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> transformations, so there is no need to traverse tree again.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">☄️ Integration with Babel</h2><a id="user-content-️-integration-with-babel" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: ☄️ Integration with Babel" href="#️-integration-with-babel"><svg 🐊<strong>Putout</strong> has dynamic nature of loading:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>plugins</code>;</li><li><code>processors</code>;</li><li><code>formatters</code>;</li></ul><p dir="auto">It was a nice adventure to have support of such a wonderful feature of <code>Yarn</code> as <a href="https://yarnpkg.com/features/pnp" rel="nofollow"><code>Plug'n'Play</code></a>.For this purpose new <code>env <code>PUTOUT_YARN_PNP</code>.</p><p dir="auto">So if you use package <strong>eslint-config-hardcore</strong> you should run <strong>ESLint</strong> this way:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="PUTOUT_YARN_PNP=eslint-config-hardcore eslint ."><pre>PUTOUT_YARN_PNP=eslint-config-hardcore eslint <span class="pl-c1">.</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">⛓ Using href="https://github.com/coderaiser/putout/blob/master/packages/putout/lib/cli/exit-codes.mjs">exit codes</a>:</p><table><thead><tr><th>Code</th><th>Name</th><th>Description</th><th>Output Example</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td>0</td><td><code>OK</code></td><td>no errors found</td><td><code><empty></code></td></tr><tr><td>1</td><td><code>PLACE</code></td><td>found places with errors</td><td><code><violations of rules></code></td></tr><tr><td>2</td><td><code>STAGE</code></td><td>nothing in stage</td><td><code><empty></code></td></tr><tr><td>3</td><td><code>NO_FILES</code></td><td>no files found</td><td><code>🐊 No files matching the pattern "hello" were found</code></td></tr><tr><td>4</td><td><code>NO_PROCESSORS</code></td><td>no processor found</td><td><code>🐊 No processors found for hello.abc</code></td></tr><tr><td>5</td><td><code>NO_FORMATTER</code></td><td>no formatter found</td><td><code>🐊 Cannot find module 'putout-formatter-hello'</code></td></tr><tr><td>6</td><td><code>WAS_STOP</code></td><td>was stop</td><td><code><empty or violations of rules></code></td></tr><tr><td>7</td><td><code>INVALID_OPTION</code></td><td>invalid option</td><td><code>🐊 Invalid option '--hello'. Perhaps you meant '--help'</code></td></tr><tr><td>8</td><td><code>CANNOT_LOAD_PROCESSOR</code></td><td>processor has errors</td><td><code><unhandled exception></code></td></tr><tr><td>9</td><td><code>CANNOT_LOAD_FORMATTER</code></td><td>formatter has errors</td><td><code>🐊 @putout/formatter-dump: Syntax error</code></td></tr><tr><td>10</td><td><code>RULLER_WITH_FIX</code></td><td>ruller used with <code>--fix</code></td><td><code>🐊 '--fix' cannot be used with ruler toggler ('--enable', '--disable')</code></td></tr><tr><td>11</td><td><code>RULLER_NO_FILES</code></td><td>ruller used without files</td><td><code>🐊 'path' is missing for ruler toggler ('--enable-all', '--disable-all')</code></td></tr><tr><td>12</td><td><code>INVALID_CONFIG</code></td><td>config has invalid properties</td><td><code>🐊 .putout.json: exclude: must NOT have additional properties</code></td></tr><tr><td>13</td><td><code>UNHANDLED</code></td><td>unhandled exception</td><td><code><unhandled exception></code></td></tr><tr><td>14</td><td><code>CANNOT_LINT_STAGED</code></td><td>cannot lint staged</td><td>🐊 --staged: not git repository`</td></tr><tr><td>15</td><td><code>INTERACTIVE_CANCELED</code></td><td>interactive canceled</td><td><code><empty></code></td></tr></tbody></table><p dir="auto">Example of providing invalid option:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-shell notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="coderaiser@localcmd:~/putout$ putout --hello🐊 Invalid option `--hello`.
